name: Honey Soy Garlic Wings | Marion's Kitchen
description: Wings and wedges… the kids (and the grown-ups!) will love this one! With an Asian honey and soy glaze, these sweet and sticky oven-baked chicken wings are fuss-free and flavour-packed. Serve with sour cream and sweet chilli sauce on the side for an Aussie twist!
keywords: Chicken, Chicken wings, Chilli Sauces, Family favourites, Honey Soy Garlic, Kid-friendly, Marinades, Marion’s Original Marinades, Sweet Chilli, Weekend meals
recipeIngredient: 1 bottle Marion’s Kitchen Honey Soy Garlic Marinade (go to where to buy to find a store)
finely sliced spring onion (scallions), to serve
1 tsp sea salt, plus extra salt for boiling
Marion’s Kitchen Sweet Chilli (go to where to buy to find a store)

recipeInstructions.text: Step 2.For the crispy oven-baked wedges, cook the potato wedges in boiling salted water for 10 minutes. Drain and pat the wedges dry with paper towel. Spread them out onto a baking tray (use 2 trays if one is not large enough to fit the wedges in one layer). Sprinkle over the oil, garlic powder, paprika and salt. Gently toss to coat. Then roast in the oven for 1 hour (turning the wedges over halfway) or until crispy and golden.

Step 3.In a large bowl, combine the wings with the Honey Soy Garlic Marinade. Spread the wings out onto a baking tray lined with foil. Cook in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Then take the tray out of the oven and use a spoon to baste the wings with some of the juices and sauce in the tray. Place back into the oven and cook for another 30 minutes or until cooked through.
Step 4.Pile the chicken wings up on a platter and sprinkle with spring onion. Serve with the potato wedges and the sour cream and Spicy Sweet Chilli for dipping.

publisher.name: Bring the Best Flavours of Asia to Home Kitchens
